Description: Semi circular artificial eye in stone. Only fainted traces of black pigments, including outline is painted along the edge. Whole surface is heavily stained. Object is fairly complete (only tip of an edge is missing) but now consists in three fragments. The front is convex, while the base is flat. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90806 and EA 90807 origianlly formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (1st row, 2nd from the right of fig. 1)
